quanteda
  • Reference
  • Articles
  • News

Distance matrix between documents and/or features

These functions compute distance matrix between documents and/or features from a dfm and return a standard dist object.

Compute a similarity or distance matrix between documents and/or features from a dfm and return a standard dist object.

textstat_dist(x, selection = character(0), n = NULL,
  margin = c("documents", "features"), method = "euclidean", upper = TRUE,
  diag = FALSE)

textstat_simil(x, selection = character(0), n = NULL,
  margin = c("documents", "features"), method = "correlation",
  upper = FALSE, diag = FALSE)

Arguments

x
a dfm object
selection
character or character vector of document names or feature labels from the dfm
n
the top n highest-ranking items will be returned. If n is NULL, return all items.
margin
identifies the margin of the dfm on which similarity or difference will be computed: documents for documents or features for word/term features.
method
method the distance measure to be used; see Details
upper
whether the upper triangle of the symmetric \(V \times V\) matrix is recorded
diag
whether the diagonal of the distance matrix should be recorded

Details

textstat_dist options are: "euclidean" (default), "euclidean", "hamming", "Chisquared", "Chisquared2", and "kullback".

textstat_simil options are: "correlation" (default), "cosine", "correlation", "jaccard", "eJaccard", "dice", "eDice", "simple matching", "hamann", and "faith".

Note

If you want to compute similarity on a "normalized" dfm object (controlling for variable document lengths, for methods such as correlation for which different document lengths matter), then wrap the input dfm in weight(x, "relFreq").

See also

dfm

textstat_dist, as.list.dist

Examples

# create a dfm from inaugural addresses from Reagan onwards
presDfm <- dfm(corpus_subset(inaugCorpus, Year > 1980),
               remove = stopwords("english"), stem = TRUE)
#> 

## distance

# compute some document distances
(tmp <- textstat_dist(presDfm, margin = "documents"))
#>              1981-Reagan 1985-Reagan 1989-Bush 1993-Clinton 1997-Clinton
#> 1981-Reagan                 57.68015  64.79969     91.20855     83.06022
#> 1985-Reagan     57.68015              69.94283     89.92219     79.58643
#> 1989-Bush       64.79969    69.94283               92.27134     83.13844
#> 1993-Clinton    91.20855    89.92219  92.27134                  72.92462
#> 1997-Clinton    83.06022    79.58643  83.13844     72.92462             
#> 2001-Bush       95.72356   101.74478  93.68031     64.32729     72.31874
#> 2005-Bush       93.33274    96.51943  92.98387     70.39886     79.44810
#> 2009-Obama      81.83520    80.75890  80.61017     84.88816     67.29042
#> 2013-Obama     103.88455   104.52272 104.20653     70.46276     71.86793
#>              2001-Bush 2005-Bush 2009-Obama 2013-Obama
#> 1981-Reagan   95.72356  93.33274   81.83520  103.88455
#> 1985-Reagan  101.74478  96.51943   80.75890  104.52272
#> 1989-Bush     93.68031  92.98387   80.61017  104.20653
#> 1993-Clinton  64.32729  70.39886   84.88816   70.46276
#> 1997-Clinton  72.31874  79.44810   67.29042   71.86793
#> 2001-Bush               56.23166   78.24321   54.69004
#> 2005-Bush     56.23166             85.39321   66.68583
#> 2009-Obama    78.24321  85.39321              72.10409
#> 2013-Obama    54.69004  66.68583   72.10409           

# for specific comparisons
textstat_dist(presDfm, "1985-Reagan", n = 5, margin = "documents")
#> Warning: non-square matrix
#>              1985-Reagan 1981-Reagan 1989-Bush 1993-Clinton 1997-Clinton

## similarities

# compute some document similarities
(tmp <- textstat_simil(presDfm, margin = "documents"))
#>              1981-Reagan 1985-Reagan 1989-Bush 1993-Clinton 1997-Clinton
#> 1985-Reagan    0.9685409                                                
#> 1989-Bush      0.9599217   0.9537449                                    
#> 1993-Clinton   0.9391137   0.9452609 0.9358174                          
#> 1997-Clinton   0.9386791   0.9468983 0.9381904    0.9241745             
#> 2001-Bush      0.9498797   0.9371453 0.9543776    0.9258829    0.9321614
#> 2005-Bush      0.9346990   0.9297108 0.9349331    0.9142198    0.9077993
#> 2009-Obama     0.9387730   0.9422163 0.9407657    0.9000505    0.9382904
#> 2013-Obama     0.9389438   0.9409353 0.9370933    0.9118394    0.9387808

# compute some term similarities
textstat_simil(presDfm, c("fair", "health", "terror"), method = "cosine",
               margin = "features", 20)
